remarks: Minus 1 times a vector is the underlying group's inverse element. Equation 2 of [Kreyszig] p. 51.  (Contributed by NM, 25-Nov-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
vcm.1 $e |- G = ( 1st ` W ) $.
vcm.2 $e |- S = ( 2nd ` W ) $.
vcm.3 $e |- X = ran G $.
vcm.4 $e |- M = ( inv ` G ) $.
vcm $p |- ( ( W e. CVecOLD /\ A e. X ) -> ( -u 1 S A ) = ( M ` A ) ) $.
